<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Student of the Staff](/Feats.aspx?ID=2859) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=389" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 45 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
[Arcane Cascade](/Actions.aspx?ID=756), [twisting tree hybrid study](/HybridStudies.aspx?ID=5)

</column>

---

You've studied the staff extensively to learn the hidden capabilities of your chosen weapon. When you critically succeed at an attack roll using a staff, you apply the [critical specialization effect](/Rules.aspx?ID=235) of the [club](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=5) group. While you're in Arcane Cascade stance, your staff gains the [deadly d6](/Traits.aspx?ID=174) trait, with the damage from the deadly die being the same damage type as the extra damage from Arcane Cascade.

 In addition, you can place [property runes](/equipment/runes/weapon-property-runes) into a magic staff you prepare, even though a magic staff can't typically hold property runes. You must first inscribe the property runes into your [spellbook](/Equipment.aspx?ID=53), using the same process as [transferring a rune](/Rules.aspx?ID=737). The rune takes the form of a specialized diagram in your spellbook, occupying one page. You can't inscribe runes that can't be placed on a non-magical staff, nor can you inscribe the [_shifting_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=302) rune. When you prepare a staff, you can impart any number of property runes from your spellbook into the staff, up to the limit imposed by the staff's [_weapon potency_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=281) rune.
name: Student of the Staff
prerequisite: Arcane Cascade, twisting tree hybrid study
